chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall a b c : nat, a + b = a + c -> b = c

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Nat.log2_unique' : forall a b c : nat, 0 <= b -> 0 <= c < 2 ^ b -> a = 2 ^ b + c -> Nat.log2 a = b
Nat.div_unique : forall a b q r : nat, r < b -> a = b * q + r -> q = a / b
Nat.mod_unique : forall a b q r : nat, r < b -> a = b * q + r -> r = a mod b
Nat.pow_succ_r : forall a b : nat, 0 <= b -> a ^ S b = a * a ^ b
Nat.log2_unique : forall a b : nat, 0 <= b -> 2 ^ b <= a < 2 ^ S b -> Nat.log2 a = b
gcd.bezout_sc : forall p q a b m : nat, a * p + b * q = 1 + m -> gcd.divides p m \/ gcd.divides q m -> gcd.is_gcd p q 1
Pos.gcdn_greatest : forall (n : nat) (a b : positive), Pos.size_nat a + Pos.size_nat b <= n -> forall p : positive, (p | a)%positive -> (p | b)%positive -> (p | Pos.gcdn n a b)%positive
gcd.bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> gcd.is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
BinNatDef.N.div_eucl = fun a b : N => match a with | 0%N => (0%N, 0%N) | N.pos na => match b with | 0%N => (0%N, a) | N.pos _ => BinNatDef.N.pos_div_eucl na b end end : N -> N -> N * N Arguments BinNatDef.N.div_eucl (_ _)%N_scope
Nat.div_mod_unique : forall b q1 q2 r1 r2 : nat, r1 < b -> r2 < b -> b * q1 + r1 = b * q2 + r2 -> q1 = q2 /\ r1 = r2
gcd.bezout_generalized_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat & {u : nat & {v : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ gcd.is_gcd p q g /\ gcd.is_lcm p q l /\ p = u * g /\ q = v * g /\ a <= v /\ b <= u}}}}}}
BinPosDef.Pos.gcdn = fix gcdn (n : nat) (a b : positive) {struct n} : positive := match n with | 0 => 1%positive | S n0 => match a with | (a'~1)%positive => match b with | (b'~1)%positive => match (a' ?= b')%positive with | Eq => a | Lt => gcdn n0 (b' - a')%positive a | Gt => gcdn n0 (a' - b')%positive b end | (b0~0)%positive => gcdn n0 a b0 | 1%positive => 1%positive end | (a0~0)%positive => match b with | (_~1)%positive => gcdn n0 a0 b | (b0~0)%positive => ((gcdn n0 a0 b0)~0)%positive | 1%positive => 1%positive end | 1%positive => 1%positive end end : nat -> positive -> positive -> positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.g...
Nat.b2n = fun b : bool => if b then 1 else 0 : bool -> nat Arguments Nat.b2n _%bool_scope
Nat.testbit_unique : forall (a n : nat) (a0 : bool) (l h : nat), l < 2 ^ n -> a = l + (Nat.b2n a0 + 2 * h) * 2 ^ n -> Nat.testbit a n = a0
Nat.testbit_spec' : forall a n : nat, Nat.b2n (Nat.testbit a n) = (a / 2 ^ n) mod 2
BinNatDef.N.to_nat = fun a : N => match a with | 0%N => 0 | N.pos p => Pos.to_nat p end : N -> nat Arguments BinNatDef.N.to_nat _%N_scope
VectorSpec.append_comm_cons : forall (v : VectorDef.t ?A ?n) (w : VectorDef.t ?A ?m) (a : ?A), VectorDef.cons ?A a (?n + ?m) (VectorDef.append v w) = VectorDef.append (VectorDef.cons ?A a ?n v) w where ?A : [ |- Type] ?n : [ |- nat] ?m : [ |- nat]
VectorDef.append = fix append (A : Type) (n p : nat) (v : VectorDef.t A n) (w : VectorDef.t A p) {struct v} : VectorDef.t A (n + p) := match v in (VectorDef.t _ n0) return (VectorDef.t A (n0 + p)) with | VectorDef.nil _ => w | VectorDef.cons _ a n0 v' => VectorDef.cons A a (n0 + p) (append A n0 p v' w) end : forall (A : Type) (n p : nat), VectorDef.t A n -> VectorDef.t A p -> VectorDef.t A (n + p) Arguments VectorDef.append {A}%type_scope {n p}%nat_scope
Init.Nat.testbit = fix testbit (a n : nat) {struct n} : bool := match n with | 0 => Init.Nat.odd a | S n0 => testbit (Init.Nat.div2 a) n0 end : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments Init.Nat.testbit (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive option (A : Type) : Type := Some : A -> option A | None : option A Arguments option _%type_scope Arguments Some {A}%type_scope a : rename Arguments None {A}%type_scope
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
plus_reg_l : forall n m p : nat, p + n = p + m -> n = m
plus_is_one : forall m n : nat, m + n = 1 -> {m = 0 /\ n = 1} + {m = 1 /\ n = 0}
plus_is_O : forall n m : nat, n + m = 0 -> n = 0 /\ m = 0
Nat.add_sub_eq_r : forall n m p : nat, m + p = n -> n - p = m
